headline: With Maduro Out, Venezuelan Bondholders Hope for Rally
summary: Investors holding underwater Venezuelan bonds are predicting the assets could rally on Monday on the belief that the American incursion will ultimately lead to relaxing U.S. sanctions that have kept Venezuela out of the global financial system.  “There is now more optimism that there’s a path to negotiating something with a representative government in Venezuela,” said Hans Humes, chief executive officer of Greylock Capital, which holds a range of Venezuelan government bonds.  “People are going to be on high alert for any kind of breakdown of social order,” Humes said.

content.title: With Maduro Out, Venezuelan Bondholders Hope for Rally
